page.title: 08Mills In Sheerness
page.content: There were 3 flour{mills}in Sheerness until 1862 when one of them caught fire and was ruined. As it was built of wood, with a tarred roof it was completely destroyed. The mill had been built in 1810 behind the Free- masons Hall in Sheerness High Street. The second mill, known as the Great Mill stood in the High Street and was operated by {steam}until 1918 and was then pulled down in 1924. A third mill , called the Hundred Acre Mill, the base of which can still be seen in the yard of the Seaview Hotel in the Broadway, worked until 1878. The opening of{the rail- {way}caused the closure of the mills and the loss of this{industry}as they were eventually pulled down.
